faq.question: What is the formula for rectangle area?
faq.answer: The area of a rectangle is calculated by multiplying its length by its width: Area = Length × Width.

faq.question: What units should I use?
faq.answer: You can use any unit of length (meters, feet, inches, etc.). The area will be in square units of that measurement (square meters, square feet, etc.). Just make sure both length and width use the same units.

faq.question: Can I use this for squares?
faq.answer: Yes! A square is a special case of a rectangle where length equals width. You can enter the same value for both length and width.

faq.question: What if I have the perimeter?
faq.answer: If you have the perimeter and one dimension, you can calculate the other dimension first: Perimeter = 2 × (Length + Width). Then use the area formula.
